title: Alphabet snaps six straight sessions of gains (NASDAQ:GOOG)
text: 400tmax/iStock Unreleased via Getty Images Alphabet (NASDAQ:GOOG) shares snapped six straight sessions of gains on Friday, as the stock closed 1.5% lower to $142.17. The California-based tech giant gained about 7% in the preceding six sessions. The stock has lost more than 50% in the last one year, compared to the over 30% rise of the broader S&P 500 Index. GOOG is down 4% over the past one month. The stock closed 2.5% higher on Thursday at $144.34. Looking at Seeking Alpha's Quant Rating, GOOG has a Strong Buy rating with a score of 4.93 out of 5. The company received A+ for profitability, while it got a D+ in the prospect of valuation. Turning to the Wall Street community, 47 analysts gave GOOG a Buy and above. 12 analysts have given the stock a Hold recommendation, and no one recommended Sell or lower. Seeking Alpha analysts are also bullish and see the stock as a Buy. “Google is currently facing doubts about its AI product Gemini and its ability to maintain its dominance in search, but I believe it is undervalued and presents a buying opportunity,” pointed out a recent Seeking Alpha analysis. Another Seeking Alpha analysis by Gytis Zizys said that GOOG has strong financials with a large cash position and steady growth in margins and profitability.
